thread.title: Baseball: Dodgers, Kershaw top Mets, stay alive
thread.title_full: Baseball: Dodgers, Kershaw top Mets, stay alive

author:
Mike Fitzpatrick 

Associated Press
title: Baseball: Dodgers, Kershaw top Mets, stay alive
text:
Baseball: Dodgers, Kershaw top Mets, stay alive By Mike Fitzpatrick Posted: 10/13/2015 08:18:02 PM   08:19:43 PM PDT Los Angeles Dodgers pitcher Clayton Kershaw (22) delivers against the New York Mets during the first inning of baseball's Game 4 of the National League Division Series, Tuesday, Oct. 13, 2015, in New York. (Kathy Willens/AP) NEW YORK -- Clayton Kershaw ended his five-game postseason skid with seven brilliant innings while pitching on three days' rest, and the Los Angeles Dodgers beat the New York Mets 3-1 on Tuesday night to force a deciding Game 5 in the National League Division series. 
The series shifts back to Dodger Stadium on Thursday. 
Game 2 winner Zack Greinke will try to lead the Dodgers to a spot in the N.L. Championship Series against the Chicago Cubs. Jacob deGrom, who beat Kershaw in Game 1, is set to start for the Mets. 
Kershaw gave up one run and three hits. The reigning N.L. MVP and Cy Young Award winner was 1-6 with a 4.99 ERA for his postseason career entering this start. Advertisement
